definition: foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: My instep arch not only keeps the ache.
sentences.chinese: 我拱起的腳背仍疼痛著。

sentences.english: A sturdy, low shoe that laces over the instep.
sentences.chinese: 一種結實的腳背上系腳帶的矮鞋。

sentences.english: Soft leather upper with beautiful gathering at the instep and an adjustable side buckle.
sentences.chinese: 柔軟的皮革鞋面與腳背聚集在美麗的和可調的方扣。

sentences.english: Easy slip-on style with elastic straps across instep.
sentences.chinese: 簡便的風格上滑橫跨腳背的鬆緊帶。

sentences.english: Two hook-and-loop straps across the instep accommodate various instep heights.
sentences.chinese: 整個腳背的鉤環肩帶適應不同的腳背高度。

sentences.english: Two hook-and-loop straps across the instep accommodate various instep heights.
sentences.chinese: 整個腳背的鉤環肩帶適應不同的腳背高度。

sentences.english: He had shrapnel up to the knee, his ankle was severed and his instep was blown off.
sentences.chinese: 他的膝蓋中了彈片，踝關節被切斷，腳背被炸飛了。

sentences.english: This machine can mold the joint point and instep point simultaneously.
sentences.chinese: 一次整型動作即可同時完成關節點與腳背點之定型。

definition: fitting one's feet (of shoes or socks)
to take off costume and makeup/bottom garment (trousers etc)
popliteal (anatomy)/hollow at the back of the knee
